TopicTitle: [0.22] B9 Aerospace Pack / R4.0c / New pods, IVAs, engines, fuselages & structures

Articles.Content:
Here's a spaceplane I made with the new Sabre Engines!

It's actually the first spaceplane I designed that actually made it to orbit and back. I hope it's not because the Sabre engines could be overpowered.
is there a way to get the other parts there are only 83 in the new pack
I think I might cry...
i had the same problem i think there are missing parts from previous versions of the mod
The Falcon

Awesome, awesome work! I'm really happy with all the new parts--fills in a few holes that I was really itching for (like S2 cargo bays) and some things I didn't even know I needed!

I do have one problem though--I have a space station I built with mostly B9 parts, and since updating I'm getting a bug where my space station just vanishes, all except for one part that just floats in space. I can't interact with it at all and if I try to IVA I get a NullReferenceException in the debug toolbar. Does anyone have any idea what might be the problem? I would really hate to have to start over--the space station was a TON of work to put together.

Well, My first attempt to build a shuttle type craft using the new pack ended in failure, It promptly fell over backwards.......

(I'll see about posting a screen later to show what I've been working on...)

I've tried to both download the Spaceport link and the mediafire mirror and neither have Sabre engines for me. I'm fairly sure it's missing parts. Anyone advise on where to download the complete pack?

Something I quickly made with the new parts.

Edited June 2, 2013 by Retro.Humanoid

Is anyone else having the issue where the 4x4 reinforced plates won't attatch to the plate adapters? It's somewhat annoying.

An example -

Really loving the new pack, B9. Everything is looking great, as normal.

My favorite parts in the pack currently are:

-The S2 Reusable Pod: It's gorgeous, complete with a proper IVA, and the RCS thrusters work. Also it's my favorite looking pod of the set.

-The RCS ports that can fire in all reasonable directions. This eliminates one part per RCS port on spaceplanes. Normally, I have to place a normal RCS 4-direction port, and then a linear. This part covers all the bases and is how RCS ports should be. It's gorgeous in looks and in function.

-The new Info Drive. This needs to be a stock function, it's like a README in-game. So incredibly useful.

-Hybrid engines. While I haven't been able to play long enough to get a successful plane with these, they eliminate a lot of hassle and can streamline plane building.

I wish the big pod and the supersonic pod had IVA views, but I'm sure that'll come in time. For the time being, everything is gorgeous. Keep up the good work!

-M5K

Edit 2: it just occurred to me that it might have to do with me playing version 0.20. I will investigate.

I had this issue aswell but I was running on .20, went ahead and updated to .20.2 and everything loaded up fine aswell as the .craft files.

The sabre precooler (both M and S) attach nodes seem to be inside the model as well. Also I'm guessing given B9's new position that this part pack will be integrated as the spaceplane update?

Worked it out.

Changing the Sabre Precooler Body M node numbers to

node_stack_top = 0.0, 1.25, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -1.25, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0

node_attach = 0.0, 0.0, 1.25, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0

makes the nodes attach perfectly so the model doesn't clip through other parts. Also the General Parameters have the M part filed under S, not really important but if you have OCD like me good to change. And the Small Precooler Body nodes are about

node_stack_top = 0.0, 0.62, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0

node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.62, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0

node_attach = 0.0, 0.0, 0.625, 0.0, 0.0, -1.0

Edited June 2, 2013 by Punk

For some reason, Deadly Reentry 2.1 RC4 causes the SABRE M engine to not work. That is, on launch, the engine doesn't show the "Air" gauge, and has NaNU for the fuel flow (fuel flow only happens after being staged and any amount of throttle being applied).

If toggled to rocket mode and back to air-breathing mode, the air gauge then appears. Unfortunately, when it is throttled up in this state, though the engine roars, no flame or heating effects occur, and though the right-click menu shows that it is producing thrust, and the resources menu shows it is draining fuel.

Rocket mode acts the same way.

I have tried modifying the .cfg for engine to be mostly identical to the SABRE S engine (which works just fine), however, this has not proven fruitful. Though it is probably not due to a bug in B9, I hope documenting it somewhere would be helpful to others who may be having this problem.

On an unrelated note, apparently due to parts overlapping something fierce on the SCVD Vonnegut, the shielded docking port keeps freaking out and removing itself violently from the fuselage.

Edited June 2, 2013 by rifter
Hey can someone teach me how to properly use (balance) the VTOL engines? I'm always over-turning, I can never get a steady hover.

I don't know if this is a bug with B9 or not, but when I'm in orbit my ship rolls to the right under its own volition. I turn the ASAS on and the roll stops, but I can see the control surface jamming for a hard left roll.

It happened after I switched to the Shielded Docking Port. Now, I had a real problem with getting it to dock. It said it was docked, but it never appeared to even though I got the GUI option to Undock.

Edit: fixed it with a part reload.
